gimp_creation_guide.logo192: 192x192 pixels, PNG with transparency, Cubic/NoHalo interpolation
gimp_creation_guide.logo512: 512x512 pixels, PNG with transparency, create largest first then scale down

2_footer_component.description: Created professional footer with NEH acknowledgment and accessibility statement

implementation.display_scope: Home page only (both authenticated and unauthenticated)
implementation.sticky_footer: Uses flexbox to stay at bottom on short pages, scrolls naturally on long pages
implementation.layout_approach: HomePage wrapped in Box with minHeight: calc(100vh - 64px) and flex: 1 on content

accessibility_statement.text: This website is committed to accessibility standards. WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliant
accessibility_statement.standard: WCAG 2.1 Level AA (current standard for institutional websites)
accessibility_statement.rationale: WCAG 2.1 AA is industry standard for government/institutional sites

contact.text: If you experience any accessibility issues with this website, please contact us.

accessibility_features.aria_labels: All links have descriptive aria-labels mentioning new tab behavior
accessibility_features.keyboard_navigation: All interactive elements fully keyboard accessible
accessibility_features.screen_reader_friendly: Proper heading structure and link announcements
accessibility_features.responsive_design: Column layout on mobile, row on desktop

design_decisions.home_page_only: User explicitly requested footer only on home page, not site-wide
design_decisions.sticky_positioning: Not position:fixed - stays at bottom on short pages, scrolls on long pages
design_decisions.color_scheme: Material-UI grey[200] background for light mode, grey[800] for dark mode
design_decisions.dividers: Uses Material-UI Divider for visual separation between sections

3_password_visibility_toggle.description: Added show/hide password toggle to login form

handler_functions: handleMouseDownPassword() - prevents button from stealing focus

ui_component.location: InputAdornment at end of password TextField
ui_component.icon: Visibility (eye) when hidden, VisibilityOff (eye-slash) when visible
ui_component.disabled_state: Button disabled during login loading state

ux_pattern.icon_convention: Action-based (shows what clicking will do, not current state)
ux_pattern.hidden_state: Eye icon → click to show password
ux_pattern.visible_state: Eye-off icon → click to hide password
ux_pattern.industry_standard: Matches Google Material Design, Microsoft, Apple patterns
ux_pattern.rationale: Icon represents action (affordance), not state - better usability

accessibility.aria_label: Dynamic - 'Show password' when hidden, 'Hide password' when visible
accessibility.focus_management: onMouseDown prevents button from stealing focus from input
accessibility.disabled_state: Button disabled during loading to prevent interaction

design_discussion.question: Should icon show current state or action?
design_discussion.answer: Icon shows action (what will happen when clicked)
alternatives_considered: Text toggle (rejected - takes more space, less universal)
design_discussion.evidence: Industry leaders (Google, Microsoft, Apple) all use action-based icons

4_hybrid_link_navigation.description: Implemented hybrid navigation pattern for list pages - clickable rows + proper links on identifiers
4_hybrid_link_navigation.motivation: Enable power users to right-click and open records in new tabs while maintaining convenient row-click navigation
4_hybrid_link_navigation.problem: Material-UI Link components using component='button' with onClick handlers don't support browser right-click menus
4_hybrid_link_navigation.solution: Use React Router Link components for identifiers, stopPropagation to prevent row click conflict

styling.variant: body2 or h6 depending on context

clickable_elements.CollaboratorsList: Display name (both table and mobile card views)
clickable_elements.CollaboratorDetail: Related item titles (in associated items list)

user_experience.option_1: Click identifier → proper link with right-click support
user_experience.option_2: Click anywhere else on row → convenient quick navigation
benefits: Right-click shows 'Open link in new tab'
Power users can work with multiple tabs
Maintains convenient row-click for regular users

accessibility_benefits.screen_readers: Identifiers properly announced as links with descriptive labels
accessibility_benefits.keyboard_navigation: Tab to link, Enter to follow, Ctrl+Enter for new tab
accessibility_benefits.semantic_html: Uses proper <a> tags instead of buttons
accessibility_benefits.seo_friendly: Search engines can follow links (if applicable)

technical_decisions.why_stopPropagation: Prevents link click from also triggering row click handler
technical_decisions.why_RouterLink: Enables proper HTML <a> tags with href attributes for right-click support
technical_decisions.why_hybrid: Balances power user needs with convenient UX for all users
technical_decisions.why_identifiers: Natural semantic choice - identifiers are primary reference points

pattern_reusability.established_pattern: Can be applied to any future list components
pattern_reusability.consistent_styling: All lists use same link styling for uniformity
pattern_reusability.mobile_compatibility: Works on mobile with long-press context menu

5_user_guide_updates.description: Updated user guide with comprehensive navigation documentation

content_added: Overview of flexible navigation on all list pages
Two methods to open records (identifier links vs row clicks)
Tips for efficient navigation (right-click, keyboard shortcuts)
Practical example showing real-world use case

content_elements: Bulleted tips for different use cases
Concrete example (opening related items in new tabs)

key_messages: Identifiers (catalog numbers, names) are proper links
Row clicks provide quick navigation convenience
Works consistently across all list pages
user_education.practical_example: When editing a collaborator record, you might right-click on related item catalog numbers to open them in new tabs for reference while keeping your main edit page open.

placement_rationale.why_getting_started: Universal feature applying to all lists - learn once, use everywhere
placement_rationale.why_not_individual_guides: Avoids repetition across multiple model-specific guides
placement_rationale.cross_references: Individual guides can reference this section if needed

hybrid_navigation_pattern.description: Clickable rows for convenience + proper links on identifiers for power users
hybrid_navigation_pattern.when_to_use: Any list component displaying records that users might want to open in new tabs
benefits: Supports both casual and power user workflows

home_page_only_footer.description: Footer appears only on home page, not site-wide
home_page_only_footer.rationale: User decision - acknowledgments relevant to landing page, not needed on every page
home_page_only_footer.implementation_approach: Footer component included directly in HomePage, not in App layout
home_page_only_footer.sticky_positioning: Uses flexbox with minHeight to position at bottom without position:fixed

password_visibility_toggle.description: Standard show/hide password pattern with action-based icons
password_visibility_toggle.icon_convention: Shows action (what will happen), not state (what it is)
password_visibility_toggle.accessibility_pattern: Dynamic aria-label, focus management with onMouseDown

favicon_workflow.decision: Place favicon sources in frontend/public/, build process handles deployment
favicon_workflow.rationale: Standard React app structure, automatic build integration
favicon_workflow.maintenance: Replace files in frontend/public/ and rebuild

footer_placement.rationale: User preference - acknowledgments contextually relevant to landing page
footer_placement.implementation: Component lives in HomePage, not App layout

footer_positioning.decision: Sticky footer using flexbox, not fixed positioning
footer_positioning.rationale: Stays at bottom on short pages, scrolls naturally on long pages
footer_positioning.technique: minHeight: calc(100vh - 64px) with flex: 1 on content area

hybrid_links.decision: Primary identifiers become proper links, entire row remains clickable
hybrid_links.rationale: Balances power user needs (right-click, new tabs) with casual user convenience (click anywhere)
hybrid_links.evidence: Common pattern in enterprise applications (Gmail, Jira, GitHub)

wcag_standard.rationale: Current standard for institutional and government websites
wcag_standard.scope: Documented in footer, enforced in development practices

password_icon_convention.decision: Action-based icons (show what will happen when clicked)
password_icon_convention.rationale: Matches industry standards (Google, Microsoft, Apple), better UX
password_icon_convention.rejected_alternative: State-based icons would add cognitive load

footer.link_labels: All external links have descriptive aria-labels with 'opens in new tab' notice
footer.responsive: Column layout on mobile, row on desktop
footer.keyboard_navigation: All elements fully accessible via keyboard

password_toggle.aria_labels: Dynamic labels that match button state
password_toggle.focus_management: Button doesn't steal focus from input field

hybrid_links.keyboard_shortcuts: Standard Ctrl+Click, Ctrl+Enter work as expected
hybrid_links.focus_indicators: Visible focus states on link elements
